snippet: The Knicks arrived for Game 5 at Madison Square Garden dressed in black, a choice that bothered their coach, Mike Woodson.
abstract: Howard Beck On Pro Basketball column notes that New York Knicks coach Mike Woodson frowned upon arrogance his players displayed by arriving for Game 5 of playoff series against Boston Celtics dressed in black, as if to imply that Boston's demise was imminent; observes that after leading best-of-seven series, 3-0, New York has failed twice to close out series, allowing Boston to turn near sweep into 3-2 nail-biter.
lead_paragraph: The Knicks arrived for Game 5 at Madison Square Garden dressed in black, a choice that bothered their coach, Mike Woodson.

headline.seo: Knicks’ Fashion and Sense Went Their Own Ways
headline.main: Fashion and Sense Went Separate Ways
headline.print_headline: Fashion and Sense Went Separate Ways
